title: U.N. chief sets out disarmament vision, from hand grenades to H-bombs
text:
May 24, 2018 / 3:14 PM / Updated 36 minutes ago U.N. chief sets out disarmament vision, from hand grenades to H-bombs Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
GENEVA (Reuters) - U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres set out a vision for global disarmament on Thursday, billed as the first ever push for comprehensive arms control by a leader of the world body. United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres delivers a speech on disarmament and denuclearisation at the University of Geneva (UNIGE) in Geneva, Switzerland, May 24, 2018. REUTERS/Denis Balibouse
“We are living in dangerous times. Cold War tensions have returned - to a world that has grown more complex,” he told an event at the University of Geneva, noting that many in the audience were not born when the Cold War ended.
Guterres said leaders had the responsibility to minimize the risk of deadly weapons, and said that disarmament was a concern for every country and should cover every weapon, “from hand grenades to H-bombs”. Reporting by Tom Miles; editing by Stephanie Nebehay
